body.p:
Eddyville Ky.
Oct. 18 1862
To his Excellency J. F Robertson
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned Citizens of Lyon County would respectfully represent to Your Excellency that at the October term 1856 of the Lyon Circuit Court a judgement was obtained against J V Hildreth and W W Hildreth for the Sum of $100, each upon a forfeiture of a recognizance bond and that application was made to Govr Morehead for a remission of the same, which was by him respited for 6 months, and afterwards for 6 Months longer, but no remission of the fine was ever made the records of the Circuit clerks office shows that the fees of the Commonwealth attorney & officers of the Court have all been paid and the portion being poor and having larger families to support & executions now pressing the parties, we most respectfully ask that under the Circumstances your excellency will extend to them that clemency which we think is due to them, that is, that you remit the fines of each, as we are well satisfied the money cannot be collected without distressing their families.

Respectfully
F Harrison

Smithland Ky Oct 31 1862
Gov Robinson Dear Sir

at the Request of several of my Constituents of Lyon County I have Signed the enclosed Petition beleaving it to be true Just and proper. the gentlemen that the Petition is in faver of are good & worthy citazens and men of limated means and are absolutely unable to pay the fine Beleaveing that you could confer a favor on none more worthey and none that would feel more greatful. after presenting my kindest personal Regards to you And hopeing to hear from you soon on this Sugect I Reman your

obedient servent
Jonas Martin
Member of the Ky Legislature

J. V. Hildreth &c
Pettn
The gratitude for Exetv indulgence
JFR
Upon the representation of G. Martin as to the facts in this case I remit one half of the fine 28 Jan 1863

Lyon Cir Ct
$100 } Recog
Issd Jany 28 1863
